Instruction: Dice the onion, mince the garlic, and grate the ginger. Chop the tomatoes.
In a large skillet, heat some oil over medium heat.
Add the diced onion to the skillet and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and grated ginger to the skillet and cook for another minute.
Stir in the chopped tomatoes, curry powder, turmeric, cayenne pepper, and salt.
Cook for 2-3 minutes, until the tomatoes begin to break down.
Add the canned chickpeas (rinsed and drained) and coconut milk to the skillet.
Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes, until the flavors have melded and the sauce has thickened.
Serve hot as a delicious and spicy side dish, optionally garnished with fresh cilantro.
